remarks: A module has a basis iff it is isomorphic to a free module.  In settings where isomorphic objects are not distinguished, it is common to define "free module" as any module with a basis; thus for instance ~ lbsex might be described as "every vector space is free."  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 26-Feb-2015.)
